event.title: 1727, Charles Calvert, 5th Lord Baltimore (then governor of the Maryland Colony) awarded

data.event: In 1727, Charles Calvert, 5th Lord Baltimore (then governor of the Maryland Colony) awarded a land grant for present-day Mount Pleasant to James Holmead.
James's son, Anthony, inherited the estate in 1750 and named it Pleasant Plains.

event.title: created the District of Columbia in 1791

data.event: After the United States Congress created the District of Columbia in 1791, Pleasant Plains estate became part of Washington County, a section of the District lying between what now is Florida Avenue and the Maryland border.

event.title: is preserved in Holmead Place, a short street located west of Thirteenth Street between Spring and Park Roads NW, in what now

data.event: In the 21st century, the family name is preserved in Holmead Place, a short street located west of Thirteenth Street between Spring and Park Roads NW, in what now is Columbia Heights.

event.title: 1796, Robert Peter, Georgetown's pioneer businessman, conducted

data.event: During 1794 and 1796, Robert Peter, Georgetown's pioneer businessman, conducted title descriptions.
